meanings.sent1: In the army, the general holds a high rank.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to climb the ranks in her company.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed he held the highest rank in the household.
meanings.sent4: Among the flowers, the sunflower held the rank of tallest.
meanings.sent5: The king's crown symbolized his rank and authority.

meanings.sent1: The rank smell of rotten eggs filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The garbage left out for days had a very rank odor.
meanings.sent3: The skunk sprayed a rank scent to protect itself.
meanings.sent4: The old cheese had a rank aroma that made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent5: The gym locker room had a rank stench after a long day of practice.

meanings.definition: A line or row of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The students stood in a single rank during the assembly.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers marched in perfect ranks on the parade ground.
meanings.sent3: The books on the shelf were arranged in a neat rank.
meanings.sent4: The ducks swam in a straight rank across the pond.
meanings.sent5: The trees in the orchard were planted in a row and formed a rank.

meanings.definition: To have a particular position in a list of people or things based on quality, importance, etc.
meanings.sent1: Her performance in the competition helped her rank first.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant consistently ranks high in customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to rank itself above the dog in the household hierarchy.
meanings.sent4: The new movie quickly ranked as the most-watched film of the year.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's dedication allowed him to rank among the top competitors in the world.
